criterion: Provides a clear and concise overview of the main symptoms of acute angle-closure glaucoma.
Mentions the urgency of the situation and the need for immediate medical attention.
Correctly identifies the main symptoms of acute angle-closure glaucoma, including eye pain, blurred vision, and redness.
Provides a detailed explanation of the treatment options, including medications and surgical interventions.
Inaccurately states that acetazolamide is the only medication used to treat acute angle-closure glaucoma.
Asks the user if they have any specific questions or concerns about the treatment plan.
Uses natural language and avoids using overly technical jargon.
Follows the user's lead and asks clarifying questions to ensure understanding of their concerns.
Fails to mention the importance of prompt medical attention in cases of acute angle-closure glaucoma.
Inaccurately states that the condition is not typically associated with nausea and vomiting.
